data.title: Meet Your Admissions Team
data.meta_description: Our transfer admissions team is available to help you with your application, program insights, scheduling a visit, and financial aid. We are here to help!
data.text:
We are here to help you determine which program is right for you, as well as to help walk you through the application process. Feel free to contact us via phone or email or attend one of our on-campus events. The Office of Admissions is open Monday through Friday, from 8:30 a.m. to 5 p.m. Walk-ins are always welcome, but appointments are preferred so that we can better serve you.

If you are a prospective international student, please contact the Office of International Admissions at international@bridgeport.edu.

Through my education, I have background in politics, French, and teaching. I truly believe that education empowers people, and I enjoy helping students obtain their professional goals.

In my free time, I like to cook, go on hikes, and root for the Patriots.

Favorite color: Blue

Favorite movie: Braveheart

Favorite book: The Plague by Albert Camus

Favorite food: Steak

Best part about my job: Meeting new people and helping them achieve their goals

Something you don’t know about me: I have owned 2 English mastiffs

Three words to describe me: Kind, loyal, diligent

I graduated from Southern Connecticut State University with bachelor’s degrees in both Elementary Education and Spanish. I also have a master’s degree in Educational Technology from the University of Saint Joseph. Before working at UB, I was a third grade teacher for 10 years. I consider myself a life-long learner and am passionate about helping others achieve their educational and professional goals. In my free time, I enjoy being with my family and friends, live music, and watching hockey (go Rangers!).

Favorite color: Mint green and gold

Favorite movie: All of the Harry Potter movies. I’m also a big fan of the TV shows Gilmore Girls and Ted Lasso.

Favorite book: Because of Winn-Dixie by Kate DiCamillo

Favorite food: Nachos or pasta

Best part about my job: Assisting students in furthering their education and reaching their goals.

Something you don’t know about me: I was a competitive Irish dancer as a child.

Three words to describe me: Reliable, patient, funny

I received my bachelor’s degree in English from Southern Connecticut State University in 2022. At Southern, I worked as a writing tutor and loved helping students feel more confident about their writing abilities. Since graduating, I have worked in education and am excited about being back at a university. I am looking forward to making lasting connections at UB. In my free time, I like to hike, read and take care of my plants.
